summary: Email chain between Assistant U.S. Attorneys and a supervisory attorney at the Metropolitan Correctional Center regarding a subpoena and request for Jeffrey Epstein's phone call recordings and email correspondence while incarcerated. The communication includes corrections to attorney contact information and a query about visitor logs.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The incarcerated individual whose phone calls and emails are being subpoenaed by the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Adam
persons.context: Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York corresponding about the subpoena for Epstein's communications.

persons.name: Blachman
persons.context: Another Assistant U.S. Attorney copied on the email chain regarding the subpoena request.

persons.name: Eric
persons.context: Assistant U.S. Attorney (USANYS) involved in the email correspondence about the subpoena.

connections.description: Adam, as an Assistant U.S. Attorney, is seeking communications records for Epstein as part of an investigation.
Blachman is copied on legal correspondence regarding the subpoena for Epstein's communications.
Eric is involved in the email chain concerning the subpoena for Epstein's phone and email records.

events.title: Initial subpoena sent with incorrect information
events.description: An initial subpoena for Epstein's phone calls was sent but contained incorrect attorney contact information, requiring a correction.

events.title: Revised subpoena and request for emails
events.description: A corrected subpoena for Epstein's phone call recordings (excluding attorney calls) and a written request for his email correspondence were issued.

locations: New York Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, 10007
Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was actively subpoenaing Jeffrey Epstein's phone call recordings and email correspondence while he was incarcerated in July 2019.
Epstein's inmate number was 76318-054 at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.
The subpoena specifically excluded recordings of phone calls made to Epstein's attorneys, indicating an effort to respect attorney-client privilege while gathering evidence.
A query was made about obtaining Epstein's visitor logs, suggesting an interest in tracking his social contacts while in custody.
The email chain shows coordination and correction of legal requests between Assistant U.S. Attorneys and prison officials.
